summary: The Restoring Lethality Act seeks to eliminate statutory provisions related to diversity, equity, and inclusion within the Department of Defense. This includes repealing sections of the U.S. Code related to the duties of the Secretary of Defense, the Chief Diversity Officer, diversity on selection boards, diversity in military leadership, and the identification of gender/pronouns in correspondence. It also amends provisions regarding human relations training and repeals strategic plans and senior advisor positions related to diversity and inclusion.
